column5: me and (okuma-sheffield) and a buddy hit up the eastern tribs on sunday risking the rivers might be full blown from the rain we got on friday, saturday. surprisingly, the water was PERFECT. nice greenish colour, current not too fast, and not much debris from the rainfall.  we showed up at about 6:30am and there were about 8-10 anglers fishing already. while setting up, those guys were pulling fish after another. i had no hits for a good solid hour, then it happened.   my first ever steelhead   then i tie on a new leader due to the fray it caused from the fight, but i insisted on using the exact same bait. about 10-15 drifts, at the same spot, my float sank fast!   she gave me a good 10 minute fight bringing me up and downstream. it was a fight and a half!   and the release.   it was definitely a day to remember, my first ever steelhead and a decent size one too.
I know that feeling very well, KelfuN.  I got my first, second and third bests just last week.  Great report, and fine pictures too.  Thanks.
Sweet!  I'm gonna lose my trout river fishing virginity this week hopefully!  I just purchased a nice setup.  Looks like you had a blast, nice catch.
Congrats on your first Kelfun! Thats a real nice first as well.
awesome steelie.. love the release shot..  get him next year when it's another 3 lbs heavier!!!
nice fish for your first!   Hawk
Hey!! Congrats!  Those are real nice fish you caught there!  Looking forward to more reports from you...I forsee another PB in the near future.  The fall run has just begun!
Uh-Oh, Rod in the mouth and the whole bit... you look like a pro already!  Congrats dude.
Great report and pics KelfuN Congratulation on your PB  Nice looking steel Thanks for sharing Leechman
thanks for all the great comments guys! im hoping to go back friday to try my luck again.  about the biting rod picture, i saw other guys doing that in some pictures, so why not?!?! lol
KelfuN, congrats on your first river 'bow.
That was our little group   You did well, congrats.
